name: Gangtok
description: Capital city of Sikkim at 1650m altitude, MG Marg pedestrian street, Tibetan handicrafts, monasteries, cable car, Flower Exhibition Centre, vibrant markets, mix of Nepali, Bhutia, and Lepcha cultures, gateway to North Sikkim.

name: Rumtek Monastery
description: Largest monastery in Sikkim, seat of Karmapa (Karma Kagyu lineage), built 1960s, replica of original Tsurphu Monastery in Tibet, golden stupa, Buddhist teachings, murals, thangkas, prayer wheels, panoramic views, 24km from Gangtok.

name: Enchey Monastery
description: 200-year-old Nyingma Order monastery in Gangtok, Solitary Temple meaning, annual Chaam (mask dance) during Losar, Guru Padmasambhava legend, prayer hall with Buddhist deities, peaceful location, city views, 3km from Gangtok center.

name: Tsomgo Lake
description: Glacial lake at 3753m altitude, 40km from Gangtok, frozen in winter, changes colors with seasons, yak rides, sacred to Sikkimese, Baba Harbhajan Singh Temple nearby, permits required, snow-covered peaks, Indo-China border proximity.

name: Nathula Pass
description: Indo-China border pass at 4310m, part of ancient Silk Route, closed on Mondays and Tuesdays, permits required, Indian Army presence, bunkers, snow-covered year-round, views of China side, restricted border trade point (Wednesdays).

name: Tashi Viewpoint
description: Sunrise viewpoint 8km from Gangtok, panoramic views of Mt. Kanchenjunga (third highest peak), Mt. Siniolchu, Mt. Pandim, Himalayan range, clear skies essential, prayer flags, early morning visits (4-5 AM) for best views.

name: Phodong Monastery
description: 18th-century Kagyu Order monastery, rebuilt 1977, 260 monks, annual Chaam dance festival (28th-29th day of Tibetan 10th month), murals depicting Buddhist legends, old and new monastery sections, 38km from Gangtok.

name: Lachung Village
description: Mountain village at 2750m, base for Yumthang Valley, Lachung Chu river, apple orchards, traditional Lepcha and Bhutia culture, Lachung Monastery, homestays, unique self-governance Dzumsa system, permits required, 125km from Gangtok.

name: Yumthang Valley
description: Valley of Flowers at 3564m altitude, alpine meadows with rhododendrons (24+ species), primulas, poppies, hot springs, Yumthang Chu river, Shingba Rhododendron Sanctuary, snow-covered in winter, permits required, 148km from Gangtok.

name: Zuluk
description: Offbeat hamlet at 3050m on Old Silk Route, 32 hairpin bends (Thambi View Point), sunrise over Kanchenjunga, Tukla Valley views, traditional Lepcha culture, homestays, gateway to Nathang Valley, permits required, 93km from Gangtok.

name: Namgyal Institute of Tibetology
description: Premier research institute for Tibetan studies, established 1958, museum with rare thangkas, Buddhist manuscripts, statues, ritual objects, 200+ Buddhist icons, library with 30,000+ books, Tibetan architecture, research center.

name: Ralang Monastery
description: Kagyu Order monastery built 1768, colorful murals, old and new structures, annual Pang Lhabsol festival with Chaam dances (August-September), religious ceremonies, Rinpoche residence, 6km from Ravangla, South Sikkim.

name: Pemayangtse Monastery
description: Perfect Sublime Lotus, one of oldest and most significant monasteries in Sikkim (1705), Nyingma Order, 3-storey structure, 7-tiered wooden sculpture of Guru Rinpoche's Heavenly Palace (Zangdog Palri), ancient frescoes, library, Kanchenjunga views.

name: Khecheopalri Lake
description: Sacred wishing lake for Buddhists and Hindus, footprint-shaped from aerial view, birds keep surface leaf-free (local belief), pristine forest setting, prayer flags, monastery nearby, pilgrimage site, part of Khangchendzonga Biosphere Reserve.

name: Yuksom
description: Historic first capital of Sikkim where first Chogyal was crowned (1641), Meeting Place of Three Lamas, base camp for Goecha La and Dzongri treks, Norbugang Coronation Throne, ancient tree, Dubdi Monastery (oldest in Sikkim), UNESCO heritage site.

name: Gurudongmar Lake
description: One of world's highest lakes at 5183m, sacred to Buddhists and Sikhs (Guru Nanak blessed), partially unfrozen spot (legend), pristine turquoise waters, surrounded by snow peaks, permits required, altitude sickness risk, 174km from Gangtok.

name: Lachung Monastery
description: 19th-century Nyingma Order monastery in Lachung village, colorful facade, prayer wheels, religious murals, traditional architecture, peaceful atmosphere, local monks, cultural center for village, mountain backdrop.

name: Siniolchu Peak
description: One of most beautiful mountains in world at 6888m, distinctive pyramid shape, technically challenging climb, visible from various viewpoints (Tashi, Dzongri), part of Kanchenjunga massif, mountaineering destination, photography paradise.

name: Dzongri Trek
description: Popular trek to Dzongri Top (4200m), starts from Yuksom, 6-8 days round trip, panoramic views of Kanchenjunga, Mt. Pandim, rhododendron forests, alpine meadows, Phedang meadows, Goecha La extension option, camping, permits required.

name: Namchi Char Dham
description: Pilgrimage complex with replicas of four Char Dhams (Badrinath, Dwarka, Puri, Rameshwaram), 108-foot Shiva statue (Char Dham), ropeway, Samdruptse Hill with Guru Padmasambhava statue (118 feet), panoramic valley views, Namchi town.

name: Sikkim Rumtek Festival
description: Annual Buddhist festival at Rumtek Monastery, masked Cham dances depicting triumph of good over evil, traditional music, colorful costumes, religious ceremonies, cultural performances, butter sculptures, local community participation.

name: Gangtok Flower Festival
description: Annual flower show at Gangtok showcasing Sikkim's rich floral diversity, orchids (600+ species in Sikkim), rhododendrons, primulas, flower exhibitions, cultural programs, food stalls, tourism promotion, spring celebration, White Hall venue.
